title: Basic proportions?
content:
Hi,   
   
I was wondering if anyone could point me to any directions of stable type proportions? I have been printing out typefaces and tracing them and even trying to 'measure' different parts of a face to try and understand the consistency of proportions of different faces but I don't really 'see' it. Does this make sense? Or am I just diseased with the 'rationalize everything' virus?
author: katsumi

comments.content:
[This](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018215632/http:/briem.ismennt.is/2/2.3.1a/2.3.1.01.notes.htm) useful web site refers to a German book by Peter Karow, 'Schriftstatistik' (URW Verlag, Hamburg 1992, which is full of detailed numbers on type proportions.   
   
 [This](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018215632/http:/letterlabor.de/EN-index.html) exercise - referred to at Typographi.ca - is also very interesting.
